## Data Collection & Preprocessing 

The data used in this project comes from [Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/). The dataset contains over 1000 conversations between humans and virtual assistants (VAs) that took place during customer service interactions. Each conversation consists of multiple turns where each turn represents one utterance by either party involved in the interaction - human or VA respectively. There are also metadata fields such as timestamps indicating when exactly did certain events occur within these dialogues e.g., start time stamp etc.. Additionally there exists another field called "intent" which indicates what kind of action needs to be performed next given current state of affairs i.e., whether user wants help regarding some product feature or he/she has encountered problem while using application itself then intent will specify accordingly like 'help', 'problem'. 


### Cleaning Textual Data:

Before feeding raw textual inputs into our machine learning model we need clean them up first otherwise models might get confused due to presence of unwanted characters / symbols present inside input strings leading towards poor performance metrics overall. To achieve this goal following steps could prove useful :


1.) Remove all special character except alphabets, numbers and spaces. For instance remove '@#$%^&*()_+-=[]{}|;':\/<>?"\`~'
2.) Convert every word into lowercase letters since most languages use same words regardless capitalization style employed initially. This step helps us avoid unnecessary complexity arising out differences amongst upper case vs lower cases versions of particular term appearing frequently throughout corpus being analyzed currently.
3.) Tokenize sentences based upon white space delimiters separating individual tokens comprising entire sentence. In other words split long continuous blocks consisting only alphanumeric sequences without any intervening punctuation marks whatsoever.
4.) Lemmatizing process involves reducing inflected forms back down again to their base form known as lemma. So instead of having separate entries corresponding different tenses conjugations genders number agreement features associated with single verb phrase say walk walked walking walks walker walkers walked walkeds etc... We end up getting rid off redundant information thus making things simpler yet more efficient computationally speaking.
5.) Stopword removal refers specifically removing common English language stop words including articles determiners pre
